title: Money, Interest and Prices
content: May 19, 2016 7  Wicksell and Inside Money  “Only by completely divorcing the value of money from … its commodity   function, by abolishing all free minting, and by making the minted coin   or banknotes proper, or more generally the unit employed in the   accounts of the credit institutions, both the medium of exchange and   the measure of value, only in this way can the contradiction be   overcome and the imperfection be remedied.  It is only in this way that   a logically coherent credit system, combining both economy of   monetary media and stability in the standard of value, becomes in any   way conceivable.”
